intro: Baphia capparidifolia subsp. polygalacea, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or savanna habitats. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, though its botanical features are less well-documented compared to other species in the Baphia genus.
